      • asCp1252SafeString

        public static java.lang.String asCp1252SafeString(java.lang.String unicode_text,
                                                  boolean htmlFallback)
        Best effort to re-encode string to US Windows CP1252. This is the default encoding for US Microsoft System.
        This encoding is not identical to ISO-8859-1!
        Parameters:
        unicode_text -
        Returns:
        String mutilated as a best fit to Windows ANSI CP1252.

      • asIso8859_Bytes

        public static byte[] asIso8859_Bytes(java.lang.String unicode_text,
                                     boolean htmlFallback)
        Parameters:

        htmlFallback -
        Returns:
        String mutilated as a best fit into Western European ISO8859-1 bytes.

      • asIso8859_SafeString

        public static java.lang.String asIso8859_SafeString(java.lang.String unicode_text,
                                                    boolean htmlFallback)
        Best effort to re-encode string to West European ISO_8859_1.
        This encoding is not identical to US Windows CP1252!
        Parameters:
        unicode_text -
        Returns:
        String mutilated as a best fit into a Western European String.

      • asCharsetSafeString

        public static java.lang.String asCharsetSafeString(java.lang.String unicode_text,
                                                   java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                                                   boolean htmlFallback)
        Best effort to re-encode string to specified Charset via ICU4J any-latin transliterator.
        Only works well for charsets that are LATIN/US-ASCII based.
        Parameters:
        unicode_text -
        Returns:
        String mutilated as a best fit into a charset compatible String.
